about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

about.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

hasPart.assesses: When can you drive in a bike lane? | When can you drive in a bike lane? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

suggestedAnswer.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise

comment.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise

suggestedAnswer.text: On foggy days when visibility is low

comment.text: On foggy days when visibility is low
200 feet before making a turn
200 feet before making a turn

answerExplanation.text: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

comment.text: When can you drive in a bike lane? | When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

hasPart.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

about.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

suggestedAnswer.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

comment.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

suggestedAnswer.text: Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

comment.text: Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

acceptedAnswer.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks with hazardous materials placards.

answerExplanation.text: A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

comment.text: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | A diamond-shaped sign on a truck means that the load on the truck is potentially dangerous (containing gas, explosives, etc.). Vehicles displaying these signs are required to stop before crossing railroad tracks.

hasPart.name: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice:

about.name: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice:

hasPart.assesses: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice: | When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. You should also follow farther behind the vehicle in front of you than you normally would. Quick stops should be avoided. Unless you have antilock brakes, pump the brakes to slow or stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.

comment.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.

comment.text: Maintain traction by following other vehicles closely.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.

comment.text: Pump your brakes to keep them from freezing.

acceptedAnswer.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.

comment.text: Shift to a low gear before going down steep hills.

answerExplanation.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. You should also follow farther behind the vehicle in front of you than you normally would. Quick stops should be avoided. Unless you have antilock brakes, pump the brakes to slow or stop.

comment.text: When driving on a slippery surface, such as snow or ice: | To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, you should shift to a low gear before going down a steep hill. hasPart.name: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

about.name: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should: | You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.

comment.text: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.

comment.text: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

comment.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

acceptedAnswer.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

comment.text: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.

answerExplanation.text: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

comment.text: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. hasPart.name: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:

about.name: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:

hasPart.assesses: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck: | A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.

comment.text: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.

comment.text: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

comment.text: Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning.

acceptedAnswer.text: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.

comment.text: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.

answerExplanation.text: When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

comment.text: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck: | When a vehicle makes a turn, the rear wheels follow a shorter path than the front wheels. The longer the vehicle, the bigger the difference between the paths of the front and rear wheels. Therefore, long trucks often have to swing wide to complete a right turn.

hasPart.text: You need a longer distance to stop your vehicle on a slippery road than you do on a dry road. Maintain an increased following distance when driving on slippery roads.

comment.text: No different than normal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Farther from the car ahead than normal.

comment.text: Farther from the car ahead than normal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Closer to the car ahead than normal.

comment.text: Closer to the car ahead than normal.

acceptedAnswer.text: Farther from the car ahead than normal.

comment.text: Farther from the car ahead than normal.

answerExplanation.text: You need a longer distance to stop your vehicle on a slippery road than you do on a dry road. Maintain an increased following distance when driving on slippery roads.
